summary: Creedence Clearwater Revival (CCR) was an American rock band from California, active from 1967 to 1972. They were very successful, with many top-charting songs and albums between 1969 and 1971. The band, made up of John Fogerty, Tom Fogerty, Stu Cook, and Doug Clifford, performed at the famous Woodstock festival in 1969. They broke up due to disagreements among members and with their record label. Despite this, their music is still popular today and has sold over 45 million records in the U.S.
title: Creedence Clearwater Revival
